posts.post_content:
"Glorifying the **will** is a mistake. It is simply one more **force** to be mastered." Intentional reference to [Force of Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Will), possibly? That's what I thought of when I read the flavor text. Lol  
  
In regards to the actual card, I use this in my Commander and 100 Card Singleton decks. It is a pretty solid bomb in those formats. The potential to take an opponent's trump card and turn the tables on them is just plain, evil fun. 5/5 from me.

posts.post_content:
I love the thought of watching your opponent cast [elspeth tirel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=elspeth tirel) and use her +2 while you have this in your hand.   
edit: note that it's probably not a good Idea to take elspeth and use her ultimate, since that would destroy volition reins. Either take her and pump out soldiers if you want to protect your lead on the board, or wait until they use her ultimate, then take her and pump out soldiers.

posts.post_content: I love this card. It has won me more games than I can count in draft. A favourite memory is drafting UG metalcraft, playing against infect, stealing his [Tel-Jilad Fallen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tel-Jilad Fallen), and pumping it with [Untamed Might](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Untamed Might) with X = 7. Gotta love winning with poison in a non-poison deck.

Posted By: lilwolf2005 (12/28/2011 12:08:43 AM)
Rating:

@TLD: Speaking of Permanent-stealing aura, there is even Dream Leash that, while a little harder to use is also the cheapest...

While Confiscate is easier to play in a 2-3 color deck, I think that I would play this one in a mono-U control or a Ux deck rather than Confiscate. Both good cards nonetheless! As a nice note about Confiscate, is that it first tried the "You control enchanted permanent", being perfectly balanced in a block where reigned the broke-ness, and a long before they tried again this mechanism...!
I think that both are 5/5, along with Take Possession and Dream Leash.
